description.narrative: The development objective of the project is to improve the National Highway network connectivity to less-developed areas and low-income states and enhance the institutional capacity of MoRTH to better manage the highway network under the purview of the Ministry.

participating-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Expenditures for Land Acquisition and Resettlement and Rehabilitation | Description :The Borrower shall ensurethat all land acquisition require for the purpose of the Project and any compensation, resettlement and rehabilitation payment toDisplaced Persons in accordance with the provision of the RAPs are financed exclusively out of the Borrower's own resources, and,to this end, shall provide, as promptly as needed, the resources required therefor. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :PFM Manual/Internal Audits | Description :The Borrower shall implement the Project in accordance with the PFMManual, and carry out regular internal audits and furnish such audit reports to the Bank ninety (90) days after the completion ofthe audit report | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Project Management Consultant (PMC) | Description :MoRTH to select and engage the services of a projectmanagement consulting firm (PMC) to assist the EAP Cell with project planning and implementation three (3) months after theEffective Date | Due Date :01-Apr-2014
Finance Agreement :Project Steering Committee | Description :MoRTH to maintain throughout the period of implementation of theproject a Project Steering Committee | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Road Readiness Criteria | Description :Prior to the award of the civil works contracts, the Borrower shallensure compliance with the readiness criteria for selection of roads for financing (LA Schedule 2 Section1 (c) and obtain Bank'swritten concurrence | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguard Documents Disclosure for sub-project roads | Description :The Borrower shall refrain from awarding anycontract to contractors until and unless all respective EIA(s), EMP(s), SIA(s), RAP(s)and/or TDP(s), have been publicly disclosedby the Borrower in local language(s) at the relevant project sites at least 120 days prior to the award of contract for the relatedworks. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Third Party Audit Consultant (TPAC) | Description :MoRTH to select and engage the services of a third partyaudit consulting firm to carry out semi-annual technical audits and auditsof social and environmental compliance six (6) monthsafter the Effective date | Due Date :05-Feb-2015
